title: Should I reply to emails just to say thanks? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes when knowing that their email helped you and you are grateful is likely to be useful to the recipient. My PhD advisor tends to reply just “Thanks!” almost all the time (he has excessively good manners…). It’s useful when I need a confirmation that he read my email and finds it helpful. It’s weird, even annoying when I don’t think anything in my email deserved thanking, or when my emails accumulated so he sends me 3–4 thanks briefly one after the other. And it makes me worry when I don’t receive a thanks (for something I think deserves it) from him for an unusually long time. In any case it’s still better than overusing sorry, which he also tends to do (though notably less than he used to… he’s learning).

Yes. Absolutely. 100%. YES! Gratitude shows people that you really do appreciate what they did for you, and makes them more likely to want continue communication or help you again in the future. What comes around goes around. And gratitude helps expedite the process.

Should I reply to emails just to say thanks? Absolutely should you thank anyone and everyone who may have done something or communicated something to you. Taking the time to thank those even over email allows you to form better bonds with people over time. Such a an act may be a courtesy but also reflects your culture. Since you will respond to each email anyway, you may want to include a few more lines in your thank you message to help personalize your emails.

Nowadays, personal emails, whatsapp messages, SMS one receives on a single day are so much that people are seen spending less time in office work, more on the messages There are many service organizations where they receive on average 100–150 emails, which is like “chatting on emails”. There is so much trash emails, one ends up spending more time during the weekends to keep deleting those trash emails. Conclusion Avoid, unless it is a one of those cases of where one has to mandatorily express his or her gratitude for the unusually kind act (life saving or charity gestures..etc..

Dont tell Ms. Manners, she still believes that you should get a package of thank you note from Hallmark card store cause you care enough to send the very best, address each by hand, and seal with a wax seal monogram of you last name initial.
